title.narrative: Venture Building Programme to reduce food loss in Kenya

description.narrative: Dutch company Enviu B.V. wants to create an efficient vegetable and fruit chain and reduce post-harvest loss in Kenya to increase farmers’ resilience and food security. Approximately 40% of the fruit and vegetable produce in East Africa remains underutilised for consumption due to inefficiencies in the food chain, whilst malnutrition remains a crisis in the region. To end these conflicting issues, Enviu has the ambition to improve systems in the entire chain by building and scaling local social ventures that work to reduce food losses, decrease malnutrition and increase livelihood of farmers and communities in the bottom of the chain as well as those that make healthy food more accessible for people in the ‘base of the pyramid’.Technical Assistance (DGGF-TA) provided support to develop a Venture Building Program in Kenya with the aim to validate the systematic approach of such program to develop impact focused, commercially viable business cases to reduce food loss in Kenya. The project included an assessment of issues in the value chain, of which the report is shared with 30 actors focusing on post-harvest losses in Kenya, and the selection of the following promising Kenyan businesses: Taimba, SokoFresh, Mlo Zone and Happiness Fortified who received support to develop their concepts. The project supported 12 direct jobs and resulted in knowledge transfer to at least 100 smallholder farmers and increased awareness within the entire food value chain and in particular in the supply chain of the selected businesses, for example regarding cold storage ? which will improve the position of mostly female farmers involved ? and regarding hygiene and health standards for street vendors which will improve food quality. These social ventures are currently in the process of further scale-up and attracting external investment which has the potential to create 50+ jobs and professionalise the food chains in Kenya. Furthermore, the project resulted in useful insights in how to develop similar programs and ventures that may benefit future investments and other DGGF-TA projects.
